body.markdown: This is the second part of the `Jump In` guide introducing core Python concepts in a hands-on way, using **Jupyter notebooks** as the primary environment. This page will cover variables and built-in functions. Be sure to check out the accompanying notebook for more hands-on experience.

body.title: Reusability
body.text: Effective programming is built around reusability. Creating automated, reproducible code starts with variables and functions.

body.markdown: Variable assignment stores data in a named container. In Python, use `=` to assign values: `x = 5`. Variables are case-sensitive and can store numbers, strings, lists, and other datatypes. Variables in Python are **mutable** meaning the value can be modified.

Functions create reusable code which can simplify tasks, allow iterative runs, and can make your code **much** more powerful.
